    Nimue rewrite: Booster Pathway New Fitting Method: Rt Optimisation

    Fit a nimue model to the given data using a scan fitting method

    scan_fit.Rd

    Taken from OJs code. Iteratively adjusts the Rt_rw parameters based on maximising likelihood of a short period of time in the data.

    Usage

    scan_fit(
  res,
  data = NULL,
  width = 2,
  n_span = 8,
  width_end = NULL,
  repeats = 5,
  data_window = 4,
  min_data_window = 3
)

    Arguments

    res

    A nimue simulation object

    data

    The data to fit to, for standard fits must have date and death columns; for lmic fits must have date, deaths and cases; and for excess mortality it must have deaths, week_start and week_end. Default = NULL, which uses the data in the fit

    width

    The algorithm will check values up to +- width of the current value

    n_span

    How many values between the width to check

    width_end

    The final width to check, so that the algorithm to move to a finer resolution as the proceeds, default NULL means the same as width

    repeats

    How many times to iterate through the process

    data_window

    How many data points to include onwards from the date the Rt effect comes into effect, default = NULL.

    min_data_window

    If an effects data window is less than this value then we skip it. Useful since the scan has issues with effects with only 1 or 2 data points, default = 3.

    Value

    Model object tuned to the data

    Details

    Only works with excess fits for now.

    Uses furrr for simulations later so can be run in parallel with future::plan(future::multisession(), .cleanup = TRUE)

    On this page

    Developed by Gregory Barnsley.
